tit.cmt: Wikipedia以外のWebサイトでは、せいりの方が大多数なので戻しました。よふみ：210件せいり：12,600件

sen.j: 玉乃 世履（たまの せいり、1825年9月3日（文政8年7月21日 (旧暦)） - 1886年8月8日）は、岩国藩（後の山口県）出身の裁判官。
sen.e: Yofumi TAMANO (September 3, 1825-August 8, 1886) was a judge from the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 直近のウィキでは「せいり」ではなく「よふみ」となっていたので、そちらにあわせました。
sen.e: Seiri TAMANO (September 3, 1825-August 8, 1886) was a judge from the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).
Seiri TAMANO (September 3, 1825-August 8, 1886) was a judge from the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: サッカー選手の玉乃淳は子孫である。
sen.e: Former soccer player Jun TAMANO is descendant of Yofumi.
Former soccer player Jun TAMANO is descendant of Seiri.
Former soccer player Jun TAMANO is descendant of Seiri.

sen.j: 墓は谷中霊園にある。
sen.e: His grave is located in the Yanaka Cemetery.
His grave is located in the Yanaka Cemetery.
His grave is located in the Yanaka Cemetery.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 1825年（文政8年） 岩国藩（後の山口県）に生まれる
sen.e: Yofumi TAMANO was born in 1825 in the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).
Seiri TAMANO was born in 1825 in the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).
Seiri TAMANO was born in 1825 in the Iwakuni Domain (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）7月 岩国藩公儀人を命ぜられる
sen.e: In July 1868, he was appointed as koginin (a position under domain governor) of the Iwakuni Domain.
In July 1868, he was appointed as koginin (a position under domain governor) of the Iwakuni Domain.
In July 1868, he was appointed as koginin (a position under domain governor) of the Iwakuni Domain.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）2月 会計官判事試補となる
sen.e: In February 1869, he became a trainee of audit commissioner.
In February 1869, he became a trainee of audit commissioner.
In February 1869, he became a trainee of audit commissioner.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）5月 民部官判事試補、次いで民部官の聴訟司知事となる
sen.e: In May 1869, he became a trainee of director at the Ministry of Popular Affairs, and after that, was appointed director of civil suit affairs.
In May 1869, he became a trainee of director at the Ministry of Popular Affairs, and after that, was appointed director of civil suit affairs.
In May 1869, he became a trainee of director at the Ministry of Popular Affairs, and after that, was appointed director of civil suit affairs.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）7月 聴訟権正、次いで民部少丞となる
sen.e: In July 1869, he became deputy secretary of civil suit affairs, and after that, Shojo (Junior Secretary) of the Ministry of Popular Affairs.
In July 1869, he became deputy secretary of civil suit affairs, and after that, Shojo (Junior Secretary) of the Ministry of Popular Affairs.
In July 1869, he became deputy secretary of civil suit affairs, and after that, Shojo (Junior Secretary) of the Ministry of Popular Affairs.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）7月 廃藩置県により、判事として司法省に入る
sen.e: In July 1871, after the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he joined the Ministry of Justice as a judge.
In July 1871, after the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he joined the Ministry of Justice as a judge.
In July 1871, after the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he joined the Ministry of Justice as a judge.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月 司法権大判事となる
sen.e: In November 1871, he was appointed daihanji (a judge).
In November 1871, he was appointed daihanji (a judge).
In November 1871, he was appointed daihanji (a judge).

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）4月 ギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードが拷問現場を目撃して狼狽しているところに偶然通りかかり、名村泰蔵とともに三人で司法卿大木喬任に談判する
sen.e: In April 1875, TAMANO happened to pass by Gustave Emile BOISSONADE when he was caught off balance after witnessing a torture, and negotiated with Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) Takato OKI, along with Taizo NAMURA and BOISSONADE.

In April 1875, TAMANO happened to come across Gustave Emile BOISSONADE when he was caught off balance after witnessing a torture, and negotiated with Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) Takato OKI, along with Taizo NAMURA and BOISSONADE.

In April 1875, TAMANO happened to come across Gustave Emile BOISSONADE when he was caught off balance after witnessing a torture, and negotiated with Shihokyo (administrator of Ministry of Justice) Takato OKI, along with Taizo NAMURA and BOISSONADE.

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）5月4日 大審院の設置（明治8年4月14日）に伴い、三等判事に任じられる
sen.e: On May 4, 1875, he was appointed as third-class judge when Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) was founded on April 14 of the year.
On May 4, 1875, he was appointed as third-class judge when Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) was founded on April 14 of the year.
On May 4, 1875, he was appointed as third-class judge when Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) was founded on April 14 of the year.

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）5月12日 二等判事として大審院長代理となる（院長は欠員）
sen.e: On May 12, 1875, he was appointed an acting Chief Justice as second-class judge (position of Chief Justice was vacant).
On May 12, 1875, he was appointed an acting Chief Justice as second-class judge (position of Chief Justice was vacant).
On May 12, 1875, he was appointed an acting Chief Justice as second-class judge (position of Chief Justice was vacant).

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）9月13日 正式に初代大審院長となる
sen.e: On September 13, 1878, he was formally appointed as the first Chief Justice of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
On September 13, 1878, he was formally appointed as the first Chief Justice of Daishin-in.
sen.cmt: 既出なので(Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: On September 13, 1878, he was formally appointed as the first Chief Justice of Daishin-in.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年） 大審院を離れて司法大輔となり、元老院議官も兼ねる
sen.e: In 1879, he left Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) and became Shiho-taifu (a post of Ministry of Justice), and was simultaneously appointed as Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Senate).
In 1879, he left Daishin-in and became Shiho-taifu (a post of Ministry of Justice), and was simultaneously appointed as Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Senate).
sen.cmt: 既出なので(Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1879, he left Daishin-in and became Shiho-taifu (a post of Ministry of Justice), and was simultaneously appointed as Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Senate).

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）12月 治罪法草案審査委員を命ぜられる
sen.e: In December 1879, he was ordered to be a committee member to examine the draft of Chizaiho (the Criminal Procedure Law of 1880 -1890).
In December 1879, he was ordered to be a committee member to examine the draft of Chizaiho (the Criminal Procedure Law of 1880 -1890).
sen.cmt: スペース調整しました。
sen.e: In December 1879, he was ordered to be a committee member to examine the draft of Chizaiho (the Criminal Procedure Law of 1880 -1890).

sen.j: 1881年（明治14年）7月27日 再び大審院長となる（第三代）
sen.e: On July 27, 1881, he was appointed again as the third Chief Justice of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
On July 27, 1881, he was appointed again as the third Chief Justice of Daishin-in.
sen.cmt: 既出なので(Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: On July 27, 1881, he was appointed again as the third Chief Justice of Daishin-in.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）春 大審院を休職し熱海で転地療養
sen.e: In the spring of 1885, he took a leave from Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) for medical treatment in Atami.
In the spring of 1885, he took a leave from Daishin-in for medical treatment in Atami.
sen.cmt: 既出なので(Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: In the spring of 1885, he took a leave from Daishin-in for medical treatment in Atami.

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）8月8日 大審院長在職中に自殺（享年62）
sen.e: On August 8, 1886, TAMANO committed suicide at the age of 62, still being in the office of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
On August 8, 1886, TAMANO committed suicide at the age of 62, still being in the office of Daishin-in.
sen.cmt: 既出なので(Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: On August 8, 1886, TAMANO committed suicide at the age of 62, still being in the office of Daishin-in.
